errors.error_description: The README includes a misleading statement that Kernel Tuner 'Automatically rewrites your Python code into optimized CUDA C++,' which is not a feature of the tool and will confuse users about its core functionality.
correction_candidates: Remove the bullet point: '- Automatically rewrites your Python code into optimized CUDA C++'
Clarify that this feature is experimental and must be enabled with a special flag.
Change the statement to 'Works with tools like Numba or CuPy to transpile Python'.
This feature is only available in the enterprise version of Kernel Tuner.
errors.golden_answer: Remove the bullet point: '- Automatically rewrites your Python code into optimized CUDA C++'

errors.error_description: The `pip install` command uses the incorrect package name `kernel-tuner` (with a hyphen) instead of the correct `kernel_tuner` (with an underscore), which will cause the installation to fail with a 'package not found' error.
correction_candidates: Replace all instances of `kernel-tuner` with `kernel_tuner` in the `pip install` commands.
Use quotes around the package name: `pip install 'kernel-tuner[cuda]'`.
The package was renamed; both `kernel-tuner` and `kernel_tuner` are valid aliases.
Use conda, as it correctly resolves the package name: `conda install kernel-tuner`.
errors.golden_answer: Replace all instances of `kernel-tuner` with `kernel_tuner` in the `pip install` commands.
